conversations.content: Please, you must return me to my village!
You no longer have a place there.
Henceforth, you will exist in this dark world and dance only for me.
Now go, my sweet! Dance!
(I hoped to never have that dream again.)
But now, the very thought of sleep terrifies me...
Looks like everything's in order here. ...Hmm? Is that Felicia?
O moon, grant the light of peace to all who sleep in this castle. O stars, shine the light of hope upon this darkened sky.
I offer my dance and prayers to the vast heavens above.
Good evening, Felicia. That was a beautiful dance.
Ack! How long have you been there, Euden?!
Not long. I was just on my way back to my room when I saw you.
It's quite late to be returning to your room. Were you on patrol?
Something like that. Er, but maybe you could keep this a secret from the others?
They're just going to tell me I should get more sleep if they hear about it.
Hah hah, I can imagine. It will be our little secret, then.
Thanks. But hey, what are YOU doing up at such an hour?
The embarrassing truth is that I was woken by a dream and can't get back to sleep.
I still have nightmares of the time I spent imprisoned by Thanatos.
I thought some dancing might help calm me and take my mind off it.
But I still don't feel like I can sleep.
I'm not surprised to hear that. It was a really terrible experience.
...Wait. I think I've got an idea.
Come with me, Felicia!
Er, all right. But where are we going?
Here, I made you some hot milk.
So THIS was your idea! Mmm, it smells lovely.
My mother always used to make it whenever I couldn't sleep.
She sounds like a very kind person. Thank you, Euden.
...It's a gentle taste. And the warmth puts me at ease.
Sleep should come easily after this.
I'm glad to hear it.
Hey, somethin' smells great in here! Is it pie? Or maybe TWO pies?!
Ranzal? What are you doing here?
Thought I'd pop in here for a midnight snack or three. Looks like my timin' was spot on the nose!
Well, there's no pie, but we do have warm milk. Would you like a cup?
Warm milk? Gimme!
You're up too, Mym?
I wouldn't miss a chance to sample something made by my darling.
All right, what's going on down here?
We can hear you all the way upstairs.
Huh?! Someone must have lost my invite to this party, but I'm crashin' it anyway!
Good grief. Did we wake EVERYONE?
All this just because I couldn't sleep.
You know what's best for times you can't sleep? A FEAST!
A feast. ...In the middle of the night.
Sure! If you aren't sleepy, the best thing to do is gorge yourself until you are.
Now THIS cat gets it!
Everyone has fun, THEN gets to ride the midnight train to sacktown. We're killin' a couple'a birds with one catapult!
I'm not certain that is the most appropriate way to describe this.
This sounds fun. Let's do it!
I suppose it DOES sound rather exciting now that I think about it.
Well, if Felicia's in, we've gotta do it!
I think it's a good idea. Elisanne? Cleo? How do you feel about it?
If you have no objections, neither do I.
Well then, what food does everyone want? It wouldn't be much of a feast without any.
This is going to be great!
*BURRRRRRRRP* N-not another bite. ...Maybe just one more ham? Zzzzz...
Zzz...Oh, darling...you're so cuddly...zzz...
All right, now it's my turn to be the entertainer...
Zzz...
Zzz...
Heh. Looks like they're all fast asleep.
Sorry, Felicia. This feast was really supposed to be for you.
Yet here you are helping me put blankets over people.
Oh, please don't apologize. I feel like I'll be able to sleep soundly after this.
We've all been playing around like children, and I'm exhausted.
In that case, let's hit the hay.
I think we should.
I'm sure I'll have sweet dreams tonight.
If you ever can't sleep again, just tell us, all right?
We'll throw another feast.
I will. 'Night, Euden.
Is there anything I can do to help, Euden?
Hmm? What brought this on?
I just want to DO something.
You've all given me so much— including a new home.
I want to return the favor.
Well, that's really nice of you, but we don't need anything in return.
But everyone else is making a contribution; I must do so as well.
I'll do anything—just let me know.
Well...
We could use another set of hands when it comes to cleaning the castle?
Just point me to the mop!
Actually, I can chip in as well; my schedule is remarkably light right now.
Shall we get started, then?
I'll start sweeping in this direction, Euden.
Then I'll work the opposite way.
Look out, dust! Here I come!
La la laaa...
Heh. She must really be enjoying helping if she's started sing...ing...
Durrrr...
Are you all right, Euden?
Huh?! Whu?! Who's there?!
It's me. Cleo. Why did you stop sweeping?
Huh? I did?
Yes, you stopped and stared at Felicia— in a rather slack-jawed manner, may I add.
Sorry! Sorry. I just found myself so... captivated looking at her.
I know she was just pushing a broom, but it seemed like she was dancing.
*sigh* We'll make little progress if you let yourself be so easily distracted.
Let's leave the cleaning for now, Felicia. Perhaps you could help me with the cooking instead?
Certainly!
Are you good at cooking, Felicia?
I'd say I'm reasonably competent— though likely not as good as you.
That will have to do. In any case, I'd like you to prepare the vegetables.
Right! Let me just wash them first...
(She appears to have this under control. I'll get started on the soup.)
Felicia, I'm going to need you to...
(Oh my word.)
(All she's doing is preparing the food, yet her every movement is...beautiful.)
(It's like she's actually dancing.)
Cleo, watch out!
The pot is boiling over!
Huh? Oh no!
Whew! I almost paid a steep price for being captivated by you.
I'm...sorry?
Your movements as you worked made it look like you were dancing.
Like I was dancing... Wait, WAS I dancing?!
Whatever you did, it was stunning. I couldn't take my eyes off you.
*sigh* I've done it again.
This has happened before?
My family used to say I was dancing as I helped with things.
I used to spend almost the entire day dancing, and now it seems I do so the rest of the time without thinking.
That sounds exhausting.
And yet I love it, so I've never thought of it as bothersome in the slightest.
But as a result, the motions associated with dancing come out in my daily life.
I wonder if that was what happened when we were cleaning? Ugh. I'm so sorry.
It is our fault for becoming distracted.
Old habits are hard things to break out of. You shouldn't feel bad.
But if this is how every attempt to help is going to end, there's no point in it!
The next time I help, I'll be certain not to dance!
Well, if you say so.
I'll be fine. In fact, here! Watch me sort the cutlery without dancing.
Must...move...deliberately...
Now it looks like your joints have locked. There must be some kind of happy medium we can find here.
I'll be fine. ...Oh no!
I worried that would happen. You were getting too tense.
Just assist me the way you normally would. I'll be careful not to be distracted.
Ugh. I'm so sorry...
Trying to help with chores isn't going well for me at all.
And yet, I don't want to make everyone change their ways to accommodate me.
There MUST be something I can do.
WAAIT! PLEEEEASE!
That sounded like it came from the courtyard.
COME BAAAAACK!
Oh man, there's no WAY I'm gonna ever find that now...
Luca? Why are you holding your head in your hands like that?
Hey, Felicia. Feel like laughing like an idiot AT an idiot?
What? I would never laugh at you, Luca! I'm sure it's nothing as bad as all that.
Oh, but it is. It most certainly is. So go on! Laugh! Laugh at me! LAUGH, DAMN YOU! LAAAAUGH!
Eeek! Y-you're scaring me, Luca! Just calm down and tell me what's wrong.
Oh, I'll tell you what's wrong...
The tablecloth I was drying got blown away by the wind!
It was Cleo's favorite, too—which means she's gonna skin me alive when she finds out about it.
Oh dear. That IS a problem.
Oh, I have an idea! In fact, why don't you leave this to me?
Er, are you sure about this...?
Has anyone seen Felicia today?
Now that you mention it, I don't think she was at breakfast this morning.
She's not one for oversleeping. Maybe she isn't feeling well.
That's a worrying thought. Should I go check on her?
(Uh oh... Hurry up, Felicia!)
You look restless, Luca. Everything okay?
Huh?! Oh, um, I'm just worried about Felicia! That's all. ...Really.
You have a lean and guilty look about you, sir. What do you know?
M-me? Guilty? Ha ha ha! Don't be silly! I'm just going to...go...check up on her.
If Felicia is unwell, someone considerate to her needs should be the one to see her.
R-right! Which is why a fellow sylvan like me is just the fellow to go.
Are those not both points in favor of CLEO going?
Suuuure...but also me!
Why do I get the feeling you're trying to keep me away from Felicia?
Are you hiding something?
Um... Weeeell... See, the truth is...
Luca, I did it!
That is PERFECT timing!
What have you been doing holed up in your room all this time, Felicia?
I'm sorry. I got so engrossed in making this that I lost track of time.
Is that...a lace tablecloth?
It's lovely. Did you really make this?
I've always enjoyed working with lace.
At first I used to just make dance outfits, but soon I could make lots of other things.
What inspired you to make this?
Well, yesterday the tablecloth in the laundry got—
Ahem! Aaaaah-heeeeem!
Er...I mean...I made this on a whim! Yep! Toootal whimsy.
It certainly has nothing to do with Luca letting the other one get blown away.
OH COME ON!
Ack! I'm sorry! It just slipped out!
Felicia really cannot tell a lie. Or even step carefully around one.
I see what's going on here, Luca.
*sigh* Yes, it was me. I'm sorry.
I was so very fond of that tablecloth.
And yet, I can see myself growing just as fond of this one.
Huh? Then...
Felicia has replaced what was lost, so I will let you off—THIS time.
Whew! You saved me big time, Felicia.
I really owe you one.
*sigh* In any case, it's time for lunch.
Let's have our first meal using this wonderful tablecloth.
I'm guessing you must be hungry after all that sewing, Felicia.
I certainly am!
All's well that ends well, then. Now let's dig in!
Um, what are you doing, Mym?
I feel like you're trying to prevent me from getting past you.
That's because I am!
I hear you're looking for something you can do to help out around here.
Th-that's right. I'll happily do anything I can to be of service to you all.
Then come with me!
Wh-where are you taking me? Hey! Stop pulling me!
All right, that's the door locked. No one saw us come here, right?
I don't think so. Do you have something secret that you need to tell me?
Of course it's a secret! You don't normally let everyone know when you're trying to better yourself, do you?
Better yourself?
That's right! Now then...
Teach me how you dance!
Oh! Well, of course I'm happy to try, but if I may ask, what brought this on?
My darling says your dancing is pretty.
Which means that if I can do it, he'll love me all the more!
＂That dance was beautiful, Mym!＂
＂I want to see you do it every day for me and me alone!＂
THAT'S how he's going to react. *siiigh*
Ummm... So basically, you want to learn for Euden's sake?
See? You understand.
Then I'll be happy to help.
I'm actually kind of jealous of the way you're able to declare your love without hesitation like that.
What are you saying?
I can't even come out and say I love my dancing.
In fact, I don't even know if I should say I LIKE my dancing anymore.
Oh, that's what you meant. I thought for a second I'd gained another rival.
Huh?
Never mind. Go back to the part where you were carping about your dancing.
Oh, I didn't really mean it like that.
I just can't help but feel that if I hadn't started dancing, it would have prevented all sorts of terrible things.
Thanatos would never have shown any interest in me, my home would never have been destroyed...
Well, that's true.
Without dancing, you'd likely be living a peaceful, happy life somewhere.
But your dancing has ALSO made a lot of people happy, right?
Well...
I'm sorry for how things have turned out, but no one can reverse time.
And looking gloomy isn't going to bring your village back.
Do you really think your family and friends would want you being sad all the time?
No, of course not.
Then you should hold your head high and tell the world you love dancing.
That's the best way to remember everyone you care about.
I suppose you're right...
Thank you, Mym. I feel like a weight has been lifted off my shoulders.
From now on, I'm going to proudly tell everyone that I love to dance.
Now THAT'S the kind of moxie I want to see from my instructor!
I'm glad. Shall we begin, then?
Absolutely! ...So what do I do? Strut about? Shake my booty?
Er, let's start with the basic posture. Please stand with your legs together.
Pffft. That's it? Easy!
Keep your thighs together, and don't arc your back.
Er, do you mind if I touch you? That will make this easier.
Touch away!
Well, your legs need to be like this... And your back should be like this... Oh, wait. Don't raise your shoulders.
This is terribly uncomfortable.
With practice, it will feel natural and give you a graceful posture.
Next, I want you to try walking while maintaining this same pose.
Just walk about? All right.
Wait! Just move your legs— not the rest of you.
L-like this?
That's it! Your form is perfect.
Hrm... This is harder than I had first anticipated.
Next, I need you to keep that posture while performing some basic steps.
It will be more complicated than walking, but you must maintain that form.
Just follow what I do. Ready? One, two, three! One, two, three!
One...two... Wait, what comes next?
Ugh. This is MUCH harder than I thought it was going to be.
It's certainly not easy—but don't worry. I'll stay with you until you can do it.
Right then! Next, we—
Ack! Wait, hold it! Time out! I just heard something snap!
I'm glad I brought you with me, Felicia.
I didn't think we would end up with this many groceries.
Neither did I—but the shopkeeper gave us so much extra food.
Everyone is going to be surprised when they see it all.
Cleo's head may explode with the possibilities.
And Ranzal and Luca will be happy for very different reasons.
Then Elisanne will warn them both not to eat too much.
Mym will ask what dish you like most so she can make it for you.
Meanwhile, Notte will beg Cleo to make another cupcake-marshmallow pizza— which is a thing I did not know existed until about a week ago.
Ha! We'd better get back soon so we can...
Wait. There's someone over there.
I see them. Let's hide behind the trees.
Are everyone's weapons ready?
Yes, sir. We can move out as soon as we have cover of night.
They look like imperial soldiers. What are they doing here?
There's a whole unit of them.
Should we take a detour?
Well, the two of us certainly can't take them all on. Let's sneak past, then inform the others what we've—
Stay alert, men! As soon as the sun sets, we move on the traitorous prince's castle!
What?!
We don't have time for a detour. I'm going in.
No! It's suicide!
I can't just do nothing!
I know, but I have an idea. What do you think about...
*whisper* *whisper*
Now YOU have a death wish!
But it's a much better chance than you taking on an entire legion alone.
Maybe so, but...
Let me do this. Please.
You all saved me—it's my turn to help.
...All right. I'll leave this to you.
Can't say I'm too happy about doing this at night.
You think it's cowardly?
Naw, I'd stab a man in the back and sleep like a baby. But being in a forest at night? Can't help but feel it's full of... Y'know.
...Ghosts.
Haw haw haw! Don't be a sap!
Ghosts are just a way for cowards to pretend they—Hey! Who goes there?!
A sylvan girl? Who are you? Speak!
Wh-what are you doing?!
Woah. She's...dancing.
Gaaah!
Commander?! What happened?! And where's that woman?!
There she is! Hey, you! Were you the one who attacked our commander?!
You won't distract us again! Take this!
Urrrgh!
H-hey! You okay?! ...Hell, she's gone again!
Huh? What's she doi—AAAARGH!
Her dance is so captivating...
Don't look! If you look, you'll be kill—AAAARGH!
It's a ghost... A ghost!
Run before it kills us all! RUUUUN!
Aaaaaaaaaaaaah!
...They're gone.
Whew! I was on edge the whole time, but your plan worked perfectly.
I mean, it was dynamite on paper, but so many things could have gone terribly wrong.
And that would have put you in serious danger.
I'm sorry. This is all my fault. It was my plan, after all.
I didn't mean to cause trouble.
Felicia, you SAVED us. I'd never have been able to take out all those soldiers without you here.
But weren't you scared?
Of course—but I was more concerned about the Halidom and everyone in it.
I've already lost one home— I couldn't bear to lose another.
I understand.
Besides, I had you with me.
Me?
That's right. You give me courage.
If I was still how I used to be, I would have been too scared to do anything.
But having you by my side gives me the courage to confront what I must.
That's...kind of embarrassing to have said straight to your face.
But I think you're giving me too much credit—YOU'RE the one who's stronger, completely independent of me.
You think so?
I do. After all, you're the one who saved us back there with your dance.
So thank you, Felicia.
No. Thank YOU, Euden.
I'm going to keep doing all I can to protect everyone.
The Halidom is my second home now.
I'm happy to hear you say that.
Then shall we make our way back? Everyone must be waiting.
Let's go!
